page.title: 11AGRICULTURE
page.content: FARMING AROUND MURSLEY AND DRAYTON PARSLOW IS HARD WORK AS THE SOIL IS HEAVY CLAY.THE FARMS TEND TO BE SMALLISH UNDER TWO HUNDRED ACRES WITH A PREDOMINENCE OF SHEEP. {SPRINGFIELD FARM}IS A TYPICAL FARM.THIS HAS BEEN FARMED FOR THE LAST TWENTY SEVEN YEARS BY THE SAME FAMILY.THERE ARE A HUNDRED AND SEVEN ACRES MOSTLY GRAZED BY SHEEP.THE YEILD FOR LAMBS THIS YEAR WAS 1.7.BORDER LEICESTER CROSS SUFFOLK ARE KEPT FOR MEAT.CATTLE ARE KEPT FOR FATTENING AND AT THE MOMENT TWENTY TWO CATTLE AND TWENTY THREE CALVES ARE ON THE FARM. {MARKETS}USED ARE BANBURY FOR CATTLE AND FOR SHEEP EITHER AYLESBURY OR WINSLOW.
